name: Portfolio Website
description: Designed and developed this website while experimenting with various design styles and modern web frameworks to explore layout, responsiveness, and user interaction.
longDescription: I began building this website using Bootstrap to quickly prototype the layout and styling. However, I soon switched back to vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to gain more control over the structure and behavior of the site. Eventually, I decided to do a full redesign using the Vue.js CDN for a more dynamic and component-based approach. Along the way, I reorganized the project's file structure to better separate concerns and improve scalability, resulting in a cleaner, more maintainable codebase.

name: Computer Systems - Cache Simulator & Matrix Transpose Optimizer
description: Wrote a cache simulator and optimized matrix transpose algorithm for the Haswell L1 cache.
longDescription: Wrote a cache simulator to simulate memory load, store instructions and cache hits/misses/evictions, based on the dimensions of the cache provided. Optimized a matrix transpose algorithm for the Haswell L1 cache to increase cache hits and reduce the number of total cycles; placed 2nd out of 184 students.

name: Principles of Imperative Computation - Final Project: C0 Virtual Machine
description: Learned the basics of compilers and virtual machines
longDescription: Programmed the virtual machine for the C0 programming language using C; developed knowledge of bytecode instructions, Just-in-Time compilation, and WORA (write once, run anywhere)
